intro: Plagiobothrys fulvus, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, lance-shaped leaves are arranged opposite along the stems, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Plagiobothrys fulvus is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open grasslands.
